title: Investigative Reporters and Editors (IRE) Summary of Investigative Reporting
description: A collection of notable investigative reporting stories, including those on a special state police force's handling of crimes against the developmentally disabled, zoos' failed efforts to preserve elephants, medical professionals' inflated Medicare charges, self-defense cases in Florida, large companies receiving small business contracts, fire department dispatch times, horse racing fatalities, New York City's immigration relief process, income inequality, test score irregularities, Wisconsin Governor Walker's calendars, Congressional speaking complexity, school attendance issues, Facebook app data access, underreported crimes, pipeline spills, college course GPAs, and football program violations.
